intro: [WRONG START] Calamus viminalis subvar. andamanensis, commonly known as Andaman rush reed, is a slender, grass-like plant native to the Andaman Islands. It is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems that can grow up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like clusters, typical of the Cyperaceae family. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often used in traditional crafts and construction. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, making it a common species in tropical wetlands and forest understories.
